Key Match Events: Nolan Arenado responded with an RBI single in the third inning, followed by a three-run homer by Brendan Donovan
Giancarlo Stanton laced a three-run double in the bottom of the eighth to make the deficit one run at 6-5
Alex Verdugo grounded out to end the eighth inning, maintaining the 6-5 score
Post-Match Reflections: St. Louis closer Ryan Helsley struck out Austin Wells to give St. Louis their first win in the Bronx in 60 years
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cardinals, for the first time in franchise history, defeated the Bronx Bombers at the New Yankee Stadium
This win means the Cardinals have an all-time record of 0-4 at the stadium
The last time St. Louis won a game in the Bronx was in Game 5 of the 1964 World Series
The Yankees currently maintain a one-game lead over the Baltimore Orioles in the American League East
